newsitem.title: USA: Westmoreland Coal profitable in Chapt 11.
newsitem.headline: Westmoreland Coal profitable in Chapt 11.

text.p: (All data above 000s except per share numbers)

NOTES: Westmoreland Coal Co filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Dec 23, after being unable to meet its retiree benefit obligations and unable to achieve a settlement about those benefits with its union members. It is operating as a debtor-in-possession.
Results for 1996 include $24.2 million on the sale of assets and $14.4 million in income as a result of a change in the method of accounting for "black lung" benefits.

The company said its losses in 1995 were the result of unprofitable operations at its Virginia division and Pine Branch Mining Inc. The operating loss in 1996 was $2.4 million, compared with an operating loss of $95.6 million in 1995.
